ion.  When  we  look  at  the  world
around us, we see that many things happen. Apples fall off trees, the leaves of
some trees change color in the autumn, the tides come in and go out, chickens
lay eggs, and so on. One job of scientists is to describe and classify what hap-
pens  and  what  exists.  But  scientists  also  wonder  whysome  things  happen
rather than others. Maple trees change color in the fall, and spruce trees do not,
but why? Chickens lay eggs, and monkeys do not, but why? A s
